HTMLTextAreaElementMinLength.summary: The minLength property of the interface indicates the minimum number of characters (in UTF-16 code units) required for the value of the {{HTMLElement("textarea")}} element to be valid. It reflects the element's minlength attribute. -1 means there is no minimum length requirement.

blockquote.para: If the textarea has a value, and that value has fewer characters than the minlength attribute requires, the element is considered invalid and the object's property will be true.

HTMLTextAreaElementMinLength.value: A number representing the element's minlength if present or -1.
